brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the prevalence of abdominal aortic aneurysms
      (AAA) among male patients with transient ischemic attack (TIA) symptoms. Ethiology of AAA is
      known to be common with atherosclerotic arterial diseases (coronary artery disease,
      peripheral artery disease and carotid artery disease), so the hypothesis is that AAA should
      be more common among these TIA patients, thus making screening of these patients (for AAA)
      more cost-efficient.

      Study will be carried out as a prospective screening study. Data will be collected in North
      Karelia Central Hospital within one year. All male patients with TIA symptoms will be
      recruited for the study and screened for AAA with ultrasound.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms Among Male Patients With TIA Symptoms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  male patient who has had symptoms of transient ischemic attack (TIA)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient's denial to participate

          -  Female gender

          -  Already diagnosed or treated abdominal aortic aneurysm

clinical_study.official_title: Screening of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms Among Male Patients With TIA Symptoms

authority: Finland: Valvira - National Supervisory Authority for Welfare and Health

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum diameter (mm) of abdominal aorta (outer-to-outer wall) in ultrasound
primary_outcome.time_frame: upon screening (collection of data will take one year)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
